docs.snippet: Q) So what kind of house do you have?A) I bought a house in Punta del Estate that's three blocks from the beach for $160,000. I also have a two-bedroom apartment in Montevideo for which I paid $58,000. If you come to Uruguay as a resident, you are...
docs.lead_paragraph: Q) So what kind of house do you have?A) I bought a house in Punta del Estate that's three blocks from the beach for $160,000. I also have a two-bedroom apartment in Montevideo for which I paid $58,000. If you come to Uruguay as a resident, you are entitled to duty-free importation of your household effects. I'm also told that I'll be eligible for participation in the national healthcare system, but I have yet to prove that personally.

docs.snippet: There may have been a more moving show of contemporary political art in the city this season than “The Disappeared” at El Museo del Barrio, but if so, I missed it.
